DOC.brief_summary: Late intrauterine growth restriction infrequently diagnose overall sensitivity 40 % low-risk pregnancy . In addition , late intrauterine growth restriction may associate intrauterine death poor neonatal outcome i.e . birth asphyxia hospitalization intensive care unit . The investigator hypothesis later third trimester routine ultrasound may accurate diagnose late intrauterine growth restriction .
DOC.criteria: Accurate gestational date use crownrump length 1114 week Singleton pregnancy Primiparity Normal First trimester ( 1114 week ) second trimester ( 2025 week ) scan Maternal age > 18 year No maternal opposition study Maternal diseases i.e . chronic renal disease , hypertension , diabetes , collagen vascular disease , antiphospholipid syndrome Pregnancies congenital anomaly foetal growth restriction diagnose 30 week gestation
